Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Impersonation \Im*per`son*a"tion\, Impersonification \Im`per*son`i*fi*ca"tion\, n. The act of impersonating; personification; investment with personality; representation in a personal form. [1913 Webster]

impersonation n 1: a representation of a person that is exaggerated for comic effect [syn: {caricature}, {imitation}] 2: pretending to be another person [syn: {imposture}] 3: imitating the mannerisms of another person [syn: {personation}]
